intro: Lindernia mitrasacmoides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved lindernia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Lindernia mitrasacmoides is a perennial herb that is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
